item.title: Milan Airport To Be Renamed Silvio Berlusconi Airport
item.description: Milan's main airport will be renamed after former Italian prime minister and business tycoon Silvio Berlusconi, Transport Minister Matteo Salvini said on Friday.

item.title: New PM Keir Starmer Names Top Team After Vowing To 'Rebuild' UK
item.description: Keir Starmer got down to work as Britain's new leader Friday, appointing his ministerial team after his centre-left Labour party's landslide general election victory ended 14 years of Conservative rule.

item.title: Trump Congratulates UK's Nigel Farage On His Win, Ignores Keir Starmer
item.description: Former US president Donald Trump celebrated the election of fellow populist Nigel Farage to Britain's parliament on Friday, neglecting to mention the new prime minister, Keir Starmer.

item.title: China Pledges Support For Tajikistan 'Territorial Integrity'
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping promised on Friday to defend the "territorial integrity" of Tajikistan as he announced a boost to diplomatic relations with the neighbouring country on a rare visit.

item.title: New UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy Backs 'Immediate Ceasefire' In Gaza
item.description: Britain's newly appointed Foreign Secretary David Lammy reiterated his support Friday for international efforts to secure an "immediate ceasefire" in the Israel-Hamas war and for the release of remaining hostages.

item.title: Israel-Hamas negotiations resume as U.S. hails ‘breakthrough’
item.description: A senior U.S. administration official hailed “a breakthrough on a critical impasse” as Israel ordered its negotiators to return to the Qatari capital, Doha.

item.title: President Biden congratulates Starmer after election victory
Joe Biden to hold campaign rally as fresh details about post-debate check-up emerge – live
item.description:
US president expected to make remarks in Madison, Wisconsin; latest details about check-up come after conflicting White House accounts

Joe Biden has cancelled his upcoming Sunday address to the National Education Association Staff Union after the country’s largest union announced a strike over unfair labor practice complaints including overtime nonpayments.

A statement released by Biden’s campaign team said:

President Biden is a fierce supporter of unions and he won’t cross a picket line. The president is still planning to travel to Pennsylvania this weekend, and we will have more details to share at a later point.

I know nothing about Project 2025. I have no idea who is behind it. I disagree with some of the things they’re saying and some of the things they’re saying are absolutely ridiculous and abysmal. Anything they do, I wish them luck, but I have nothing to do with them.

Continue reading...
